text: 15cl from tap at BFGM17. Appearance: clear amber with medium off-white head. Aroma: hops, horse blanket, grapes, candied sugar, trace of cannabis. Taste: high sweetness, low bitterness and nice, gentle tartness. Notes of white grapes, candied sugar and apple. Palate: medium bodied, watery to sticky texture and lively carbonation.
Pours a brown reddish color. Aromas of friut(sour apple) musty. Flavor is a subdued tart taste, not a big as I expected. Medium bodied with a slight tart mouthfeel.

Bue à la pression en 25cl au kilarney.
Couleur ambrée pas de mousse ni d effervescence. 
Nez pomme acide tout comme la bouche puis ensuite une attaque acide d un relens

I cant believe I havent had this... But its really really gross so yes I can understand why. Smells like apple juice that has sat in the sun nd taken on a light vinegar aroma. Flavour is so sweet its nauseating. Tastes like apple pulp mixed with sugar and lemon iced tea. Do not spend your money here.
bottle sample a while ago, deep amber orange pour with a white head, nose of sweet burned caramel, artificial like all of their beers, sweer caramelised apples, green apples, sweet ripe fruits

Bottle at home thanks to clockwork. Had a shitty day so figured crack a rare style tick to up the mood. Pours light brown with some floaters. Nose is candy and some caramel. Tastes of caramel, lots of pear, some yeast, candy, Lambic funk, and artificial sweetener.
Bue à la pression. Nez fruité, sucre et fruits au palais. Mal équilibrée, plutot mauvaise meme.

(tap 0,3l @ OP (Brno))
Aroma : Sweet, candy, caramel, light sour, cherry.
Appearance : Clear dark amber color. Medium white head.
Taste : Very sweet, candy-like, medium sour.
Palate : Medium body. Sticky texture. Sweet finish.
Overall : Nice sweet-sour.

Tasted from tap. Van Honsebroucks reaction to the success of Lindemans Faro, but a failure if you ask me, sweet, artificial, sugary and lacking the complexity and funkiness which the true lambic adept appreciates so much. Redundant.
Bottle thanks to Kraddel. Pours amber white head. Nose/taste of caramel, sweet malt, Belgian yeast and Balsamic vinegar. Light medium body.
25 cl bottle. Brown pour with tan lacing. Sweet and off lambic aromas. Well it lives up to the worst faro in the world rating.
Bottle at Kulminator. Clear deep gold pour with thin white head. Aroma is funky, cheesy, tons of garbage juice, really nasty. Taste is sweet, caramel, brown sugar, malt and garbage juice. Nasty crap.

Bottle (250 ml) @ Kulminator. Slightly hazy bright amber with a small white head and little lacing. Aroma is of garbage, cardboard, brown sugar and rotten eggs. Taste is very similar but is actually more disturbing because, at that stage, you know that the liquid is entering your body and you really dont know what will happen next. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Definitely one of the worst beer I have ever tried. Its horrendous for an old beer and its atrocious for a faro so that give you an idea of how bad is that one. Should I be a torturer, that would be one of my prime instruments.
Pours amber with no head. Very nice aroma of sour cherry. Taste is similar to the aroma - its sour and full of cherry.

Bottle at zytholoog
Pours brown/amber , fast fading good white head 
Sweet smell - perfumed even 
Very much alike caramelized apples . Very arteficial

Bottle at Kulminator. Drink by 2009. Caramel and cream nose, sour cream, yogurt. Medium amber-orange color with lace. Very sweet, much like ginger ale, with lemon and cream, and a bit of spoiled milk. More like a soda.

Courtesey of KyotoLefty. 25 cl. bottle sampled @ Kulminator. BBF 11/2009 so 2007 Vintage? I dont think that they are still making this. Very, very few recent ratings. Darker amber with a tanned head that only shows on the sides. Smell of cough syrup, very sweet, iron, some herbs, very sticky, some aged sweetness but additives have kept this well, thick sugar. Taste is very sweet, reminds me of Red Bull, aged Red Bull of sorts, sweet cough syrup, some herbs, iron, odd aged flavour, obv. zero sweetness. Prickling carb. this tastes a bit like an already opened energy drink, energy drink body. Not to bad actually for what it is not off-flavour from sweeteners.
Overall: Very sweet and sour, a real candy treat.Note: On-tap at De Klomp. Reviewed 2013-05-04.
Bottle @ Kulminator, Antwerp. BB 2009. Clear amber with a white head. Aroma is sweet malty, caramel and dark sugar. Flavor is quite sweet and light acidic. Dry and light acidic finish. 240712
Transfering data from personal beer file. I drank this beer a long time ago. Ill update this rating if I have the chance to drink it again.
Bottle.  Clear amber color, medium white head.  Aroma of caramel and cotton candy.  Taste is sweet, subtle summer fruits.  Too sweet for me.

Fruchtige Gerüche (Weintrauben) dringen in die Nase. Auf der Zunge süß-säuerlich bis in den Abgang. Der trockene Nachhall ist ausdauernd. 
Tjaaa... Dieses Faro erinnerte mich unwillkürlich an Mezzo-Mix (Geruch). Geschmacklich hat es mir aber ganz gut gefallen.Test vom 25.2.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche

Kirschgeruch, der leicht ins säuerliche geht, man merkt jedoch direkt, dass ordentlich nachgesüßt wurde. Süßer Kirschantrunk, künstlich wirkend. Im Mittelteil rückt das Kirscharoma dann schon fast in den Hintergrund, da die Süße sich beträchtlich ausweitet. Der Nachgeschmack ist zwar etwas sauer, die Akzente sind trotzdem auf die Süße gesetzt. So süß muss es wirklich nicht sein! 	 
Test vom 18.3.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 9,6,7,5,6,5 - 5,90

Enjoyed at the Pub St-Alexandre in Quebec City, October 2006 in company of Driss. Best before date written on label is 11-2009 and lists, 3.2% ABV. Poured a golden-orange colour that is slightly cloudy with an off-white head, and little retention. Nice smell of cider vinegar mixed with honey and some fruity sweetness. The mouthfeel was kind of watery. Sweet cherry taste that is on the mild side, with cider vinegar and red apples. Was a little sour at first, but went away with time, and went to the sweet side. I really enjoyed my first Faro experience. A really nice balance of aromas and flavours.

Bottled at Pressklubben, Stockholm.  Clear amber, minimal head. Sweet and sour with citric acid embedded in breast sugar. Slim bodied and hugely drinkable with slight caramel and barnyard. Mild lemony acidity is what lingers. Not really complex, just really refreshing.
Deep gold,small white head.Nose is malt vinegar, tart fruity palate with late arriving light sweetness.

Ok, never had a faro, read about it briefly. Chapeau Faro will follow immediately after this is finished. Deeeeeep amber and crystal clear (no sediment poured in yet) and a skiff of light tan bubbles. Sweet! Holy hell! My god - no wonder why no one makes this style - how would you sell it before it went bad? White sugar, sourness, yeast, hints of wood?, sour cherry / raspberry mix? With that said, the aroma is sure making my mouth water. And tasting.... tasting... wtf? Pop! Craigmont Pop. Those tiny rockets candy you get at halloween. Powdery weird mix of sourness... a fruity sourness, I also think there is some Lik-Em-Stik flavour as well. So yea - you could say its kinda sweet... Sweet, slick, sour and tart in a candy way on the finish. Very drinkable at least in this small dose. The winner of the two faros by a long shot - but these are two totally tasting brews.

head: goes away fast 
colour:  between light and dark orangy amber 
smell: fruitiness , wheats , sour , sugar, yeast 
taste: bit sweet and fruitier than his fellow "lindemans faro" , i like it altough i prefer maybe a bit more sourness in it , but its ok...
Smells almost of a skunky cheese, taste is better but I think half a bottle will do for now.  Citrus, sweet, etc.

YAAA!!!!!! My first Faro, another style checked off the beer list. Bright copper body no cap at all and appears to be more then crystal clear. Do very sweet smelling, must take insulin shot now.! Aroma is sour honey with extra sugar added and faint cider vinegar.  Taste like overly sweet apple juice, some cherry but then turns very vinegary at back of throat. Im getting a lemon lime like pop taste sometimes. So very sweet. It has a powdery candy quality to it like Rockets (what where my fav Halloween candy to get) when warmer it get very vinegary and less enjoyable. My empty glass smells like celery salt.
250mL bottle, pours a crisp copper with a white head. Smell of candy, lime and lots of sugar. Flavour is extremely sweet candy, some sour cherries and kind of syrupy. A little too sweet for me...
Bottle thanks to blutt59.  The smell is candy, sweet, lime, wood, and very sugary.  The look is clear, golden in color, and has a fizzy white head. The taste is fruits, soda like, sweet, and sugar.

( 25cl bottle thanks to blutt59 marked 11/2009) Pours clear amber with a ring of bubbles. Nose of sugar, light funky/woody barrel, and sour cherry. Taste is very sweet, light sour cherries, creamy, grapes, with a good creamy finish.
Bottle thanks to blutt59.  Amber pour with a white head.  Nose is syrup, sugar, and cherries.  Smooth palate with flavors of light sugar, candied cherries and a smooth aftertaste.

Big thanks to shrubber85 for this little rarity! The beer pours a caramel color with a small head. The aroma is lots of caramel and sugary sweetness, some burnt sugar and tart cherry in there as well. The flavor is much of the same bracingly cloying but pleasantly sour with tones of caramel and burnt sugar.
Bottle thanks to blutt59. Pours a deep burnt orange color. Nose is butterscotch and hazelnut syrup italian soda. Taste is like overly sweet malt vinegar. Not bad.

Bottle thanks to blutt59. Clear orange pour with small white head. Aroma is butterscotch, lemon zest, light funk. Flavor is tart, lightly acidic, lemon peel with short duration. Not nearly sour enough for me.
bottle, via trade with shrubber85,  pours and orangey brown with a sour cherry aroma, flavors of sour lemons sugary koolaid but not bad

Bottle marked 11-2009 thanks to blutt59. Another Faro! Pours with a small white head and a golden body. Aroma of sweet apple, pineapple and 7-UP. Taste is sweet with citrus, candi sugar and hay. Light bubbles.

Bottle from 16th St.Liquor in West Vancouver. Pours a dark amber color, small off-white head. Sour, earthy, fruity nose with a lot of apple tartness. Thick sugary mouthfeel. Clear candy sugar presence with sourish vinegar notes. Foamy mouthfeel in the finish. My first Faro...hopefully there are better examples of the style.

250mL bottle courtesy of oldstylecubsfan poured into a tulip.

Pours a hazy brownish orange with a small off-white head that leaves a small cap and a bit of lacing.

The aroma is not exactly appetizing with a fizzy apple cider aroma with a bit of tartness.  There is quite a bit of sugary sweetness in the nose as well.

The taste has an initial tart kick with an overall green apple sweetness.  The sweetness is pretty overpowering and really leads to a cloying, overly sweet mouthfeel that makes this one tough to drink.

Bottle at le pub st Alexandre. Pours a very dark orange amber with almost no head. Aroma of tequila!? Sweetner and vinegar. The flavor is very sweet and reminds me of an overly sweet cheap tequila cocktail. Ok this awful and fro
 having beers from this brewery before Ill assume this is not the best example of the style.

Sampled on 7/8/2009. This faro pours a deep brown color from a 25cl bottle. Small to no head. The aroma is fruity and sweet, a touch of cider and some tartness. A medium bodied faro. The malts are fruity and sweet. Touch of apple cider, yet with some tartness and a touch of funk. Nice carbonation. Its way too sweet tasting, but there are some nice malt flavors and a touch of funk, which sort of balances the sweetness. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is sweet.

Starting with a petite, short-lived tan head, this one produced a body of clear and dark orange.  Nice looking beer to go along with an interesting aroma of bitter fruit and yet some sugary notes as well.  Taste was certainly "different", with both tartness and sweetness, sweeter than I like and this was reflected in the mouthfeel; cloying it was.  Sweet finish as well.  Not a beer Id want to drink more than one of these small bottles at a sitting, better suited as an aperitif or a dessert beer.

(Bottled) Hazy darkish amber with a  smallish, firm and lightly tanned head. Aroma of sour ales, with dark fruit and lots of candi sugar, plus some spiciness. Sweet and syrupy-sugary flavor with mild fruity tartness in the background. Almost like Dr.Pepper or similar lemonade, boosted with herb liquour. Medium body, extremely sugary, low-carbonated but fizzy. Some interesting and even good flavors, but drowned deep into the sugar.
25cl, from the brewery, not complex sweet brew, yet refreshing, balanced, clear, small head, simpel brew
Bottle: Poured a cloudy brown with a Sour aroma of fruits. Taste is sweet and sugary. Some hop and spice finish.

Dégusté avec french tickler le 24 mars 2007.
Cloudy dark amber poor with low carbonation. Aromas of SUGAR and rhubarb pie. Flavors are predominant sweet, rhubabr, ginger with a small sour finish. Almost no bitterness. Very sweet palate, missing balance.
Murky amber pour.  Sweet and cloying on the palate.  Too sweet.  I am having difficulty separating out the sweet donor.

Bottle 25cl.
Pours a brown/reddish murky colour with a small size head and loads of carbonation.
Smell is very sweet, obviously caramel there with some other sweetness, very clearly the sweetness of the sugar there.
Taste is also very sweet, but not too sweet giving it a nice edge going down.
Caramel is probably the best additive to Lambic compared to Krieken and Framboise.

RE-taste on 24.10.’08
Bottle, 25 cl. 
Amber brwon color, beige head. 
Aroma sour and sweet. 
Medium body.
Taste malts, sweet and little sour. 
Not bad.

Pours a cola-brown with a fizzy brief head and a sweet aroma. Tastes like cola, very sweet indeed. Plenty of carbonation, thin pinched body with a dry mouthfeel despite the sweetness. I’m baffled as to why they put mountains of hops on the label of this bottle - probably to indicate how many they had left over after making this shockingly sweet brew.

25 cL bottle. Pours cloudy and golden amber with a lacing off-white head. Caramel and mild citric aroma. Flavour is citric to acidic with raisin like flavour to mild malty. Slight herbal flavour/aroma on the back the back of the nose.

Bottled. A hazy amber beer with a thin beige head. The aroma is sweet buttery combined with light notes of brettanomyces. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of butter and an acidic note of lemon, leading to a dry bitter finish. Thanks yespr for sharing.
Bottle.  Sweet berry and vinegar aroma.  Medium brown color with moderate head.   Sweet-tart light berry flavor - lightly musty finish.  A pleasant beer to drink.

250ml Bottle - Copper brown in colour with some orange tinges. Fruity and slightly musty aroma. Sweet tasting at first which then becomes ever so slightly sour in the fruity finish. Tangy on the tongue. A bit too commercial for my liking.

25 cl bottle. Dark copper brown color with a low tan head. Smells like ginger and cola. Starts slightly sour, gets more sour, but sugar and fruit are always present. Seems always balanced between sweet and sour, though the finish is arguably a bit sweet. Interesting. Seems more to it than some other faroes. The label depicts hop; seems they used hop only for the picture.

250ml bottle.  Mostly clear brown sugar colored body with a large head.  Big buttered ginger ale and candy sugar nose (some sprite/7-up as well).  Cola-like carbonation with super sweetened sugar flavor.  This is basically soda pop.  Liquid apple candy.  Not disgusting, dont get me wrong, just tastes like green apple soda.

0,25 l bottle bought in Brussels.
Citrus aroma. Almost baqlance between sweet and sour. Candy sugar, lemon, rhubarb.
But this style will never be my favourite!

My first Lambic Faro! 250ml bottle, thanks to Knut Albert. Hazy, dark orange body under a medium off-white head. Sweet lambic aroma with late apples and berries. Candy sweet with spicy tartness behind and with a touch of yeast. Still a bit too sweet. Lively carbonated (No.1301, shared with Knut Albert 04.04.2008).

0.25 Litter bottle generously provided by IrishBoy at the AleSmith BA release:  Color is orange-amber like strong tea with a wisp of off-white foam that fades to a halo. Aroma is lightly sweet with some red wine vinegar. Flavor starts fruity and sweet followed by a sharp tart green apple  bite and a somewhat dry, sweet and sour finish. Light body is tangy with lively carbonation. CHEERS Richard !!!
Thanks phil! Dark brown, a bit hazy, big beige head. Aroma of gingerbread cookies, fruits, kiwi. Taste very sweet, but still great flavours, strong and spicy.

300ml bottle (supermarket, Bruges)
Rich reddy orange. Sour and sharp aroma. Rich malty body - again sweet and also sour. Very pleasant, if a little simple. Hard to find real fault with it except being too sweet. But its a faro, what can you do...

Rating #1200...
12/28/2007:  Well, I have had this bottle sitting around for awhile now (since I traded for it back in March 2007), so what better time to enjoy it than now?!  ...  St. Louis Permium Faro has a toasted golden color (light honey) and pours quite clear.  It has a tasting creamy off-white head and a moderate amount of carbonation.  I like the aroma.  It has a nice blend of sweetness along with some acidic notes and hints of dry oak/wood, funk, and fermented apples.  Wow!  The flavor starts really sweet and then gives way some delicate sourness with flavors of lightly spiced (cinnamon) red wine, tart apples, and then tons of sugar.  I really like the contrast between the sweet, sour, tart, and acidic flavors.  The lingering flavor on the palate is like a sweet, candy-coated lemon head candy that is sour/acidic on the inside.  The underlying lambic can still be tasted underneath the sugary candi sweetness.  I also like the fact that this beer actually has some body to it and isnt over-carbonated.  It is delicate on the palate and seems to work well for this beer overall.  Amazingly, my wife also enjoyed this beer and called it "tasty" which is impressive since there are very few beers she will actually drink!  In my opinion, this beer is under-rated.  I wish that Faro Lambics were more widely available so that I could get it for my wife to enjoy...

25 cl bottle (Alc. 3,2% Vol. / Best before end: 12-2007 / PRFA1219A1625) from IrishBoy.  Thanks a bunch Richard.  I really appreciate it!  Rating #89 for this beer...

Reddish brown, moderate head. The aroma is artificially acidic, like ascorbine acid. The flavour is sweet with an artificial citrussy note. It reminds me of the candy shaped like lemon boats, and its too sweet and artificial. It has been added candy sugar and sweeteners, maybe they shouldnt have done that...

Bottle in trade with Irishboy, thanks Richard. Never had a Faro so this was interesting at best. Very much a non-beer to me, more like a stale fruit beverage that was way past drinking prime. Like a outdated fruit drink that has lost all of its fruit drink characteristics. Really bad

Pours a clear amber color with a thin white head. The aroma has green apples, mild sourness and sweetness. The flavor is mildly sour and sweet, theres a presence of green apples, it doesnt feel like an authentic lambic at all, more like a cheap imitation and it probably isnt 100% lambic. The body is medium with an oily texture and soft carbonation.
1/4/05. 250ml. Belgianshop. Odd orange brown color. with very minimal white head. Sweet sour aroma. Very sweet upfront with some sourness at the end. A litttle thin and too sweet.

Bottled sample via boutip. Light amber in colour with medium carbonation. Aromas of lemon and cola. Fairly sweet flavor, with notes of lemon, wet wood, cola, and maybe a hint of cherry pits. A bit tart, but the asperteme like sweetness mellows that aspect out considerably. Odd, but I still kinda like it.

Bottle from IrishBoy. Finally, my styles are complete! Now I just need to do all the Sakes. On a fresh pour, aroma is quite tart with pure white sugar notes. As the beer warms, the aroma almost completely disappears. Very tasty flavor; I really like the expression of the pure white sugar in contrast to the gentle tartness. Not at all like alco-pop fruit lambics to me at all, or like fake gueuzes. This is really unique and enjoyable and extremely drinkable. Would be perfect for a hot summer day.
Copper-red colour. Aroma: sweet, cherry, a bit skunky. Lost of carbonation. Sweet with some sourness.
Hazy copper colored brew. Very sweet aroma and flavor, cherry and red fruits. Sweet aftertaste, very sweet mouthfeel.

Bottle shared with HogTownHarry, blankboy & jerc - courtesy of HogTownHarry. Hazy reddish-brown with a small head and still body. Nose is slightly tart/funky, like a mild Flemish red laced with candy sugar. Flavour is quite nice - a great balance of tartness and sweetness, with a bit of a cidery character. Quite impressive for what is a generally derided style.

Bottle (250ml) shared with HogTownHarry, GregClow & jerc -- courtesy of HogTownHarry. Pours a hazy orange-copper with a spare diminishing white head. Nice big aroma for such a little beer: Slightly tart fruit (apples and citrus) along with yeast and spices. Flavours quite a nice surprise, its very enjoyable: Nice tartness and sweetness to it, lots of fruit and some mild spices. Medium bodied. The last Faro I had was really lame but this one rocks, I really like it.

Bottle. Lightly hazy copper body, fast fading white head. Musty, yeasty aroma with notes of apple cider. Lightly sour, sweet malt flavour combined with tart cider. Pleasant, fairly simple. Nice change of pace. Average palate is a bit flat.  Many thanks to Harry for sharing this hard to track down style! 6/3/6+-7/3/13

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2007 Bottle (250ml).  Shared with blankboy, GregClow and jerc, my bottle via trade with Boutip.  Hazy amber, small head.  Mild flemish sour aroma, tart and malty, light spice and yeast.  Sweet - wow, really nice, very sweet and sugary yet big acidity - lemon and tart green apple.  Fairly thick sugary body, very sweet and acidic --- very nice indeed!
Bottle at Dæmningen. Clear red/brown - light offwhite head. High sweetness, acid, light sourness, brown sugar, flowery, red berries, very dry finish. Dries your gumms out !!

#700:  Thanks to IrishBoy.  25cl bottle; 12-2007.  Rust colored.  Aroma of Belgian yeast, and sugary sweetness.  A little spiciness in the nose.  Tastes like sweetened fruit juice.  Hints of cherries, some tartness and a little barnyard behind the sugary sweetness.   Lots of sweetness.  A very sweet gueze Fizz on the palate.  Medium bodied, and a bit sticky & syrupy.  Light alcohol.  Very enjoyable as an aperitif.

Bottle - 250ml. Hazy amber/brown body with low carbonation and a thin off-white creamy head. Sharp hoppy aroma with fruity and herbal notes. Its malty/hoppy taste carries sweet and fruity hints. Ends with a decent sour/sweet finish. Not bad.

bottle-wow, im pleasantly suprised by this one.  dark orange with a soapy hwiteh ead.  nose is much sweeter than most lambics im used to.  like a fruity gueze or something.  sweet flavors dominate with tons of sweetart like notes with a finish of cheese.  definately unique and im very happy to be able to try such a unique brew.  lots of sweetness so im glad i only had a small sample.

Bottle. Amber orange color with a small fizzy fair lacing mostly diminishing off-white head. Aroma is light hoppy and yeasty, moderate to heavy pear, sugar (sweet). Flavor is heavy sweet and moderate acidic with a average duration. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft to flat. BBF 11/2005. Very nice ;o))

250 ml bottle, via Papsoe.  Bottle 1 of a 4 bottle Faro tasting.  Pours an orangish amber body under a small fizzy white head that faded to a partial thin covering.  Theres a little lambic-like funkiness below the sweet sugary and somewhat spicy nose.  Kind of a cinnamon and cloce combination.  Flavor is very sugary sweet up front fading to a pixie stick laced finish.  Just the slightest hint of funk present.  Mouthfeel is medium bodied with a slightly sticky sugary finish.  Soft light carbonation.  This was what it was, on par with the Chapeau Faro I had previously, and by far the worst of the 4 Faros that I had in this session.  The sugar tasted so refined that it just reminded me of drinking simple syrup.

25cl bottle via trade with jjpm74.  Here it comes the elusive faro review...Pours cloudy orange with a thin tan head.  The aroma is sweet and funky, with a sugary feeling.  The taste is sweet and sugarry and very carbonated.  It tastes sort of like sticky slightly alcholic apple juice.  Very weird, not bad, not great, glad to have had it.

Brown bottle, 25 cl, best before 12-2007, savoured on April 11 2007; eye: amber with a red hue, beige head that falls rapidly to leave a ring around the glass, lightly hazy, slight effervescence, no lacing; nose: sweet, 7-UP, horse, apple; mouth: quite sweet, syrupy, malt structure but no taste of it, maraschino cherry, long sweet finale with a hint of horse, medium body, sticky texture, quite carbonated; overall: correct

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 25 cl, meilleure avant 12-2007, savourée le 11 avril 2007; il : ambrée avec une teinte rougeâtre, petite mousse beige qui tombe rapidement pour laisser un petit anneau autour du verre, légèrement voilée, très légère effervescence, pas de dentelle; nez : sucre, 7-UP, cheval, pomme en rétro-olfaction; bouche : très sucré, sirupeux, structure du malt mais pas vraiment le goût, cerise au marasquin, longue finale sucrée avec une pointe de cheval, corps moyen, texture collante, assez carbonatée; en résumé : correct

Cloudy dark golden body topped by an off-white ring of foam.  Sweetened apple juice mixed with some kind of fruit pie.  Not the sweetest faro Ive had but the sugar is very apparent and hasnt melted into the beers body.  Limited tartness.  The added sweetness totally kills the Lambic funkiness.  That would usually be a criticism but after trying their St-Louis Gueuze I think it is for the best.

Bottle from Richard.  Thanks for this style rating for me.  Faro is something I have heard mixed reviews about, and I can see why now.  Pours out a dark brown color with a white head on it.  Smell is full of apples and sweet candy sugar.  Taste is like drinking a sour apple juice that has a quart of sugar dumped in it.  Not really pleasing at all, and a clear disappointment.  Perhaps it would work well if it was really cold outside, or something, I dont even know.  It is good to try the style, but I dont think I will want to get another Faro.

Big thanks to Beerdrenched  for supplying this tough to find style to our last beer night.  Pours copper with a moderate sized off-white head.  The aroma is similar to sweet / tart candy and has sharp lemon and dry 7-Up.  Medium cloying body with some sharp carbonation that spreads the flavor like soft carbonation would.  The flavor starts with sharp sweet flavors, cane sugar and light spice.  The finish is much of the same.  I havent had any other faros to compare this against, but I enjoyed it.

Cloudy dark amber poor with low carbonation. Aromas of SUGAR and rhubarb pie.  Flavors are predominant sweet, rhubabr, ginger with a small sour finish.  Almost no bitterness.  Very sweet palate, missing balance.

Special thanks to jjpm74 for hooking me up with this hard to find style. Poured a darkish copper color, with a big foaming head. Aroma was like sweet and sour sauce, with just a touch of leathery funk. Flavor started out with a lot of candy sweetness and sour, with a big sourdough yeastiness, leading into a balanced finish. Medium body and very drinkable.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2007 I liked this.  It has some sourness but is obviously sweetened.  There is a light barnyard, yeasty aroma.  Flavor has more yeast with sugar and just a hint of sourness.  Amber in color and well carbonated.  Light and refreshing.

Bottled. The last nonretired Faro, that I havnt had.. Dark amber coloured. Quite clear. Dense off white head. Very sweet aroma with a light sourness. Flavour is not very refined. Dominated by the overly sweet flavours. Is a bit artificial. Vague sourness is there. Is thin bodied. Is mostly sweet and light fruity in the end. Boring.
Bottle. Small white head. Hazy orange body. Oranges and vinegar aroma. Sweet sugary sour flavor.

Pours orange with sparse sustained carbonation and a white ring of bubbles.  Smells of perfume, hay, apples, sugar, some barnyard funk, some elements of dry, crisp lambic.  Tastes of sugar, cherries and is very syruppy.  Not nearly as good as the aroma suggests.  Finishes up like cherry gingerale and reminds me of sweet tarts.

A dark amber faro with a thick light moka head. Pleasant lactic cheesy aroma, light hosrblanket, cream soda. A sweet beverage with that funky cheese taste, lactic point, berries, and overall pleasant mouthfeel. A good St. Louis product. Bieropholie prvate import.

Bottle: Poured a clear medium orangey color faro with a big foamy head with quite good retention. Aroma of sugar with some tart and sourness. Taste is quite sweet which is kind of expected for faro with more tart and sourness and overall complexity then expected from this brewery. Overall, this was better then expected since this brewer is not know for following the traditional lambic way.

(Bottle 25 cl) Clear, dark amber with a rough, off-white head. Sourish aroma with notes of wood. Medium body with a fairly distinct sourness and then the pleasantly smooth and burned caramel sweetness from the brown sugars. A perfect melange of sweet and sour. Cant help it, but I really, really dig this stuff. 050207

Cloudy dark amber hue, with a beige head, leaving laces, the nose is one of sweet tartness, candied lemon peels, mild green apples sharpness and with a lemony ice thea accent,  caramel, candi sugar notes, and a hint of old wooden mustiness accent in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a sharp sweet candyish sugar maltiness, tartness character, with a mild wet oakiness, a fruity lemon ice thea leaves flavor, with an acidic note, and a faint honeyish accent, leading towards a sweet fruity ripe apples sharpness finish. A sweet lambic quincher, not for the real traditional lambic fan in you.

25 cl bottle A gift from IrishBoy - A new, hard to find style - Pours a hazy amber color with a thin off white head that faded quickly.  Light spotty lacing.   Has a slight tart, fruit (Granny Smith apple) aroma.  Has a sweet, almost fizzy fruit flavor.  Very nice.  Like a good white grape juice.  Medium body.  Easy on the palate.  Best of the few Lambics Ive tried.  A very pleasant suprise.  Thanks Richard.

(many thanks to irishboy for the hookup!)reddish-orange body with a fast fading off-white head.sour aroma mixed with a bit of green apple.flavor mixes th aroma with some wheat thrown in.honestly its really not that bad.
(Bottle, BB 05-2006)  Pours a murky dark amber body with a spare white head.  Aroma of white grapes; really sweet.  Flavor of sweet tart, chardonnay grapes, and Granny Smith apples.
Brown with a light tan head with aroma slightly tart. Caramel, along with a bit of drried friut. A sweet and tartness, caramel and a very maltiness to it interesting.

Bottle; Sweet carmelly candi, but acidic nose; slightly hazed copper with a small beige head; sweet apply flavor contrasting with a mild tartness, with some oak notes. I wish faros were more available, like the fruit lambics; I enjoy the contrasting sweetness and tartness. Without the baryard aroma notes of the Lindemans Faro, but very similiar in flavor
Bottle. Amber colour with a small white head. Aroma and taste of sweet fruits with hoppy hints. Good Faro.
Bottle. No head. Amber color. Aroma is semi weak and sweet. Taste is honey sweet. Awesome palate. Love the way the taste explodes in your mouth.

Sehr schaumfreudig für ein Lambic-basiertes Bier. Auch im Vergleich zu Referenzbieren dieser Brauart fällt der überaus zurückhaltende Geruch auf, der zwar ebenfalls säuerliche Aspekte aufweist, aber nur sehr schwach auftritt und den gesüssten Momente Vorrang gewährt. Jedoch vermittelt der Geruch nur einen Bruchteil der Süsse, der wirklich in dem Bier enthalten ist. Der erste Schluck steckt von Antrunk bis Abgang voll mit Kandiszucker, welcher jedoch zu künstlich erscheint. Die Säuerlichkeit wird dadurch stark ausgebremst und kann somit nur noch gedämpft agieren, wobei sie sich nicht ganz ausschalten lässt. Trinkbar, wenn auch viel zu süss!!
Sweetish-sour. Has some astringent oak. Honey-sweetness. And pure lemon-acidity. Kandis.
Bottlew. No head. Wonderfull amber colour. OK acetic aroma. Fantastic powerfull flavor. Oily palate. Good stuff.

Bottle from BelgianShop.com.  Pours a nutty brown with minimal head and a smidgen of lacing.  Aroma is limon and a tinge of grapefruit.  Flavor is a very sweet Sprite, with a chaser of grapefruit and Sweet Tarts.  Palate is thicker than the beer appears in the glass.  Pretty good, if you ask me but this is the only Faro Ive had so Ill have to try others to get an accurate gauge of how good it really is.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Bottled. Brown in colour. Minimun white head. It has a sweet and hoppy aroma with a slight bitterness. It has a sweet aftertaste and a sweet and hoppy taste.

Amber with a medium sized off white head.  Aroma is quite sour and barny with a touch of musty wood.  The flavour is a balancing act between sweet and sour.  The sweetness seems a little sugary while the sour is earthy.  I like the sweetness there to compliment the sour but I think the balancing act was not as crisp as it could be.
Bottled. Amber colour, small white head. Aroma of sour hops and candy sugar. Flavour is hops and candysugar also. Wellbalanced, and not too sweet.

Bottle. 2004 Vintage. Dark amber with a tall foamy white head. Nose is surprisingly earthy and woody, though it has light tart fruitiness and some sulphurous/egg notes. Taste is sweet-sour with light tart fruits, wood, light damp earthy notes and soft candy flavors. Body is light, bubbly and has a moderate carbonation feel. Finishes, again, sweet-sour and woody with light earthy notes.

Amber coloured, light sprankling, average but diminishing white head. Some sour aroma, grain-grasslike. Sweet and medium body. Finish is sweet-sour, well balanced, with the sour touch coming forward. Little sitcky near the end. NOt bad, maybe just a little to sweet.

Hazy amber colored, small white head. Woody aroma with a slight sweetness, rather old and fusty and not very pleasant. Flavor is sweeter than a mofo with a nasty note of wet wood and cellar. Mouldy, which is strange as it wasnt an aged bottle. Really bad!

(bottle) Murky and slightly hazy brown colour with a short off-white foamy head. Dusty and sugary sweet fruity aroma, slightly acidic. Sweet and sour flavour, light bodied, moderately carbonated. Sweet candied initial taste with green apples, woody sour and sweet tart finish.  Not that bad, although I couldn´t manage to drink more than one.

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2012 25cl bottle. Strong raisin, refreshing citrus aroma with slight hints of malt. An amber, light ruby in colour, light sparkling liquid with a quick dissolving beige head. Light but very sweet-sour fruit flavour. Fizzy carbonation, fruity body and thin texture, bubblegum finish. 
Excellent beer to go with dessert or have it as dessert only.

25 cL bottle. Sour aroma with a strong yeast smell. Has a hin white foamy head with little lacing. Pours with a rich redish golden color.  Taste has a sweet and sour candied green apple with a caramel malt flavor that makes for a refreshing drink. Medium bodied and fizzy palate, tingles the mouth. But overall this for me is a good beer but not something I would drink often.

25 cL bottle.  Pours ruby mahagony with a small off-white foamy head and some lazy lined lacing.  Sour lemon and yeast aroma, cellared, oak and earth notes, malty.  Sour citrus fruit, sweet candied green apple and caramel malt flavor.  Medium bodied and fizzy palate, tingles the mouth.

Bottle, 25cl. Clear hazy orange colour, with a small but somehow persistent white head. Very lively. Strong vinegar aroma with notes of fruits, just like a sweet gueuze. Taste is sweet and again with a sourish vinegar note. You definitely can sense the sugar! Almost reminds me a cider ive had in Pais Basco! Very strange but nevertheless drinkable. Must be very fresh! A little less sugar and it would be a very good faro.
[RBG Low Countries 2005] Artificial fruity nose. Hazy. golden coloured  with not much head. Not much body either... Well its not much alive. It is very sweet and juicy. Yuckie.

Bottle. Again, i have to ask...who bought this one at Kulminator?? Sweet candy-ish sort of flavours. Ever so slight tart character in the finish, but not enough to save this beer. At least it was better than the B12 beer from De Troch!
BOAAAAHHHH - having this after some wonderful aged vintages of extraordinary beauties at Kulminator was torture!!!!! Cigarett nose, amber color, little head. Sweet sugar water - TERRIBLE!
Deep amber, clear. Aromas of flowers and synthetic. Taste reminds me of syrup and cheap german candy. Drinkable but not a very god faro.

Bottled (BB 05/2006)
Dark amber color, small off-white head. Sour, earthy, fruity nose. Thick sugary mouthfeel. Clear candy sugar presence with sourish vinegar notes. Sweetened oud bruin -like. Foamy mouthfeel in the finish. As faros often - not very enjoyable.

Pour is ruddy orange/amber with thin big bubbles tan head...smell is sour, nutmeg...taste is fizzy, mildly sour fading to thick sugar water (like simple syrup)...my first Faro, seems like I would probably like one that doesnt suck...probably like it a lot...
Sugar and fruits in aroma and taste. Some viniger, sour and sweet. Refreshing but a bit disgusting on the end. Only 3.1 in alcohol. Found in Belgium.

Thanks Bockyhorse!

Bottle poured a cloudy orange with a short lived white head.
Aroma is ripe fruit and viniger.
Flavor is very sweet almost like candy.
Thick body with a sweet finish.

Had the aroma of fruit fermenting in a basement. Amber color body and not much of a head. Taste was like sucking on a sour candy that you would pick up at the grocery store. Sweet cherry and or raspberry flavor. Tart on the palate. If you like wine coolers youll like this.
UPDATED: JUL 25, 2005 The only faro until now that Ive tasted, a good sour-sweet ballans. Dark amber coloured with a small white head. But the aftertaste is way to sweet. A good beer. (Bottle 25cl)
My only faro so far. Big head. Dark orange. Sour fruit flavour with earthy dones. Starts sour, very tasty middle but finish is too sweet. Leaves a sour residue.
Copper coloured with a slight haze and medium head. Metallic barnyard aroma with a sugary background. Slightly sourish and VERY sweet. Im glad it was only a 25 cl bottle.
Begins with a tart gueuze-like quality then a sticky sweet finish ...very effervescent...not bad, a little weird...but not bad...Ill try a better quality version, though.

Bottled. Red/brown colour and no head. Sugary, tart, plasticky aroma. It´s medium tart, but very sweet. Some grapey notes in the taste and also some cork taste. Mediumbodied. I liked it. It´s not great, and tastes a bit like a soft-drink, but somewhat enjoyable.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2006 Interesting drink, pouring a golden copper body, lightly carbonated, with a white halo and film for a head.  Its got a funky, barnyard kind of a sweet-sour aroma.  The flavor starts out like a "standard" gueuze, but turns into runny sweet/sour sauce about midway through.  Its quite thick and sticky.  Its tart in ithe finish, turning sweet as the last of the liquids slides down your throat.  Someday Ill give a faro a try again, but probably from another brewer.<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Shop, Verviers, Belgium<font size=-1>

Rich copper color with a fading white head.The odors of cider vinegar with some honey notes a hint of things to come.WOW sweet and sour with a effervescence that coats your entire mouth.The Flavor was almost a cream soda ,with lambic and a splash of flanders red.I would buy some more!

Courtesy of wohlfs, a hard to get style rating here in MI. Call me crazy but I really enjoyed this brew. Only two other people gave it a three or higher? Was very sweet but enjoyable, lots of sourness and tartness, with a very crisp finish.

Unusual aroma, some sugar, dust, rather vinous, hints of vinegar. Very sweet and sugary with a bit of fruity sourness to compensate. Grape sugar, cherry, a bit sticky, of course, but certainly drinkable and better as expected.

Bottle.  My second Faro and the other was quite old so my background is limited here.  Medium amber colored with a white head.  Little lacing.  Sourish sugar aroma which reminds me of my old church.  Initial tart flavors are wiped away by a sugar rush.  Overwhelming with sugar.
Liquid sugar for pancakes and I hate pancakes. No lambic notes with tons of sugar. cloying and sticky.

Clear amber color with a small off-white head. Very sweet and sour lemon, grass, hay, and cola aroma. Extremely sweet lemon syrup flavor, with some cola, and barnyard flavors in the finish. Wet, syrup feel. A bit like a liquid lemonhead.

Glowing brown color with a small off-white head. The aroma was great...barnyard funkiness, grass, soil, tart cherries, grapes, lemon, and Pepsi. The flavor was waaaaaaay too sweet...sugary/syrupy, cola character with some apple and grape tones in the background. The feel was pretty thin and crisp...semi-wet finish. Thanks Wohlfs!
Bottle. Smells like a softdrink. Brown colour, light brown head. Quite sweet with some lemon acidity. Tastes like liquid candy.

It looks like Mezzo Mix (mix of Fanta and Coca Cola) in the glass. It also smells of Mezzo Mix with a touch of lime detergent. Very sweet candy flavour with notes of chewing gum. This is really awful. Just as bad as Alsterwasser.
Dark orange color, mildly cloudy. Little light brown head. Sweet cherry aroma, some sourness too. Very sweet, juicy-like flavor with strong cherry and apple tones.
clear red-orange colour, fine unregular foam, aroma of cellar, vinegar and sweet cherries, very sweet and oily with just a light acidity touch in a sugary finish
Bottle at Delirium Cafe, Brussels. Amber, no head, sugary aroma. Very fruity Faro - almost orange. Really rich and sweet - nice enough, but you couldnt drink much of this.
Bottle picked up in Belgim<.i>. Suprisingly dark. Somwhat lambic like, sweet but not oversweet. This is rather sweet faro.

Red-amber beer, clear; brownish little head, fast gone. Woody, lactic acid, a tad vinous and a sweetish-fruity aroma. Fruity, sour-sweet, with a nice retronasal flavour. Lactic acid and candi sugarsyrup. A bit sourish-adstringent, strange in combination with the very sweet candisyrup taste - hence some filling. Light to medium bodied. Pity, pity, pity - just a tad too sweet - if not it would be adstringent, but quite interesting. Tastes more like a rather sweet Flemish Oud Bruin, than as faro on lambic base.

Red-brown beer with large persistant head. Aroma of gooseberries. Sweet. SWEET. Metalic undertones with no lambic character. Threw it away. What a pointless beer! Wheres the market for it? What does the word Premium mean in this context? A puzzling waste of money.
Lemon/lime detergent aroma. Copper color, white head, good lace. Tastes like lemon flavored sweets with a little citric sourness, medium body and sticky.
Clear orange coloured, medium head. Very sweet syrup aroma. Sweet flavour, finishes a bit more sour. Practically pure syrup, not good.

Clear orange golden color, medium white head. Aroma of sweet gueuzes, not oaky at all but you can just smell the sugar. Taste is extremely sweet of sugar with a bit tartness. Sticky palate, like coca-cola.
